rOpenSci Newsletter

Dec 14, 2020


rOpenSci HQ

Community Calls

Join us for our next Community Call - The Wild World of Data Repositories - this Wednesday, December 16th, 2020 (10-11 AM PST). This call will be moderated by Kara Woo with speakers Daniella Lowenberg, Matt Jones, Carl Boettiger and Karthik Ram.



Software üì¶

CRAN: GitHub:

New Packages

  • The first version (v0.1.1) of outsider is on CRAN - ‚ÄúInstall and Run Programs, Outside of R, Inside of R‚Äù. Checkout the docs to get started.
  • The first version (v0.0.2) of allcontributors is on CRAN - Acknowledge all Contributors to a Project. Checkout the docs to get started.

New Versions

  • A new version (v0.6.0) of vcr is on CRAN - record HTTP calls to disk for test caching. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the HTTP testing book to get started.
  • A new version (v0.0.4) of medrxivr is on CRAN - access and search MedRxiv and BioRxiv preprint data. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the docs to get started.
  • A new version (v3.0.1) of hunspell is on CRAN - High-Performance stemmer, tokenizer, and spell checker. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the vignette to get started.
  • A new version (v0.3.1) of tacmagic is on CRAN - positron emission tomography time-activity curve analysis. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the vignette to get started.
  • A new version (v0.7.4) of webmockr is on CRAN - stubbing and setting expectations on HTTP requests. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the HTTP testing book to get started.
  • A new version (v1.13) of mcbette is on CRAN - model comparison using babette. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the docs to get started.
  • A new version (v0.2.0) of prism is on CRAN - Data from the Oregon State Prism Climate Project. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the vignette to get started.
  • A new version (v3.4.0) of rgbif is on CRAN - interface to the Global Biodiversity Information Facility API. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the occurrence manual to get started.
  • A new version (v0.3.0) of jaod is on CRAN - Directory of Open Access Journals client. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the docs to get started.
  • A new version (v1.1.1) of rnpn is on CRAN - Interface to the National Phenology Network API. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the docs to get started.
  • A new version (v0.7.3) of bomrang is on CRAN - Australian government Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) data. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the docs to get started.
  • A new version (v0.7.1) of rdhs is on CRAN - Client for Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) Data. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the docs to get started.
  • A new version (v0.4.3) of auk is on CRAN - eBird data extraction and processing. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the docs to get started.
  • A new version (v0.0.10) of phonfieldwork is on CRAN - linguistic phonetic fieldwork tools. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the docs to get started.
  • A new version (v1.3.6) of UCSCXenaTools is on CRAN - download and explore datasets from UCSC Xena data hubs. See the release notes for changes. Checkout the docs to get started.



Software Review ‚úî


We accept community contributed packages via our software review system - an open software review system, sorta like scholarly paper review, but way better. We‚Äôll highlight newly onboarded packages here. A huge thanks to our reviewers, who do a lot of work reviewing (see the blog post on our review system), and the authors of the packages!

If you want to be a reviewer fill out this short form, and we‚Äôll ping you when there‚Äôs a submission that fits in your area of expertise.


The following packages were recently submitted:

  • censo2017 > Base de Datos de Facil Acceso del Censo 2017 de Chile (2017 Chilean Census Easy Access Database)
    • Author: Pach√°
    • Issue: ropensci/software-review#414
    • Reviewers:
      • Frans van Dunn√©
      • Ana Laura Diedrichs
  • terrainr > Retrieve Data from the USGS National Map and Transform it for 3D Landscape Visualizations
    • Author: Michael Mahoney
    • Issue: ropensci/software-review#416
    • Reviewers: not yet assigned

Rich√®l Bilderbeek wrote about using his mcbette package for: Selecting the Best Phylogenetic Evolutionary Model


Dennis Irorere wrote a post about solving a problem using a GraphQL service using the rOpenSci package ghql: Accessing GrahpQL from R



Citations

The following 22 works use/cite rOpenSci software:

  • Reimuth & Zotz used CoordinateCleaner in their paper The biogeography of the megadiverse genus Anthurium (Araceae 1
  • Yu et al. used fingertipsR in their paper Impact of Vertical Integration of General Practices with an Acute Hospital on Hospital Admissions: a Retrospective Synthetic Matched Controlled Database Study. 2
  • Koch et al. used rgbif in their paper Bats as putative Zaire ebolavirus reservoir hosts and their habitat suitability in Africa 3
  • G√∂bel used cld2 in their paper Voting and Social Media-Based Political Participation 4
  • Larouche et al. used rfishbase in their paper Reef-associated fishes have more maneuverable body shapes at a macroevolutionary scale 5
  • De Sousa & Solberg used rgbif in their paper Conservation Gaps in Traditional Vegetables Native to Europe and Fennoscandia 6
  • Polaina et al. used rgbif and CoordinateCleaner in their paper Identifying hotspots of invasive alien terrestrial vertebrates in Europe to assist transboundary prevention and control 7
  • Ihaka & Gentleman used rentrez in their paper R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics 8
  • Mothes et al. used CoordinateCleaner in their paper Habitat suitability models for the imperiled wood turtle (Glyptemys insculpta) raise concerns for the species‚Äô persistence under future climate change 9
  • Scott used skimr in their paper Spatial variation in PM2. 5 concentrations across Timaru 10
  • Tonnis et al. used rnoaa in their paper Peanut FAD2 Genotype and Growing Location Interactions Significantly Affect the Level of Oleic Acid in Seeds 11
  • Da Silva Abel et al. used MODIStsp in their paper Environmental dynamics of the Juru√° watershed in the Amazon. Environment, Development and Sustainability 12
  • Vantas et al. used hydroscoper in their paper Estimating Rainfall Erosivity from Daily Precipitation Using Generalized Additive Models 13
  • Weber used pangaear in their paper Digital elevation models of German waterway and navigation 14
  • Nania et al. used CoordinateCleaner in their paper Continuous expansion of the geographic range linked to realized niche expansion in the invasive Mourning gecko Lepidodactylus lugubris (Dum√©ril & Bibron, 1836 15
  • Keppeler et al. used rfishbase in their paper The relationship between trophic level and body size in fishes depends on functional traits 16
  • Doyle et al. used bomrang in their paper Unintended Consequences of Welfare Reform: Evidence from Birth Outcomes of Aboriginal Australians 17
  • Sass et al. used rtweet in their paper Exploring social media data to understand consumers‚Äô perception of eggs: A multilingual study using Twitter 18
  • Allerton used brranching in their paper Functional Attributes of Post-Disturbance Regeneration in Puerto Rican Tropical Dry Forest 19
  • Davies et al. used rotl in their paper A meta-analysis of factors influencing the strength of mate-choice copying in animals 20
  • Becker & Han used rredlist in their paper The macroecology and evolution of avian competence for Borrelia burgdorferi 21
  • Greenville et al. used rredlist in their paper Simultaneously operating threats cannot predict extinction risk 22



Call For Maintainers

Part of the mission of rOpenSci is making sustainable software that users can rely on. Some software maintainers need to give up maintenance due to a variety of circumstances. When that happens we try to find new maintainers. Check out our guidance for taking over maintenance of a package.

We‚Äôve had eight recent examples of maintainer transitions within rOpenSci:

  • RSelenium: now maintained by Ju Kim
  • chromer: now maintained by Paula Andrea
  • qualtRics: now maintained by Julia Silge
  • rsnps: now maintained by Julia Gustavsen and Sina R√ºeger
  • webchem: now maintained by Erik Sapper
  • mregions: now maintained by Lennert Schepers (VLIZ)
  • rWBclimate: now maintained by Sergio Ibarra-Espinosa and Amanda Rehbein
  • rinat: now maintained by St√©phane Guillou



Get involved with rOpenSci

We maintain a Contributing Guide that can help direct you to the right place, whether you want to make code contributions, non-code contributions, or other things like sharing use cases.





Keep up with rOpenSci

  • Mailing list: Sign up with an email address to get this newsletter sent to your inbox -> https://news.ropensci.org/
  • Alternatively, you can subscribe to this newsletter via our XML feed at https://news.ropensci.org/feed.xml or our JSON feed at https://news.ropensci.org/feed.json
  • rOpenSci on Twitter: @ropensci
  • The rOpenSci blog at ropensci.org/blog - you can subscribe in any RSS aggregator, or manually via https://ropensci.org/index.xml. We also announce new blog posts on our Twitter account.
